titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al

name.namePart: United States District Court District of Massachusetts

extension.cause: 28:1441 Petition for Removal- Civil Rights Act

titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ORDER entered. MEMORANDUM REGARDING DEFENDANTS' MOTION FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT. In its November 8, 2011 order, the court DENIED Defendants Motion for Summary Judgment (Dkt. 58) as to Counts I and II and ALLOWED it as to Counts III, IV, V, VIII, and IX. As noted above, at n. 1, the trial originally scheduled for this case was postponed due to the unavailability of Plaintiffs counsel and the possibility that new counselwould need to be retained. If the case is to be tried before this court, in light of the fact that counsel estimate that two weeks will be needed for evidence, then (in light of the age of this case) the trial must commence by the end of February, 2012. Alternatively, and particularly in light of possible Eleventh Amendment issues, counsel may move to remand the two remaining state law claims to state court. Counsel are hereby ordered to submit a joint status report, on or before January 9, 2012, setting a trial date for some Monday on or before February 27, 2012. Alternatively, counsel may file a motion to remand Counts I and II to state court for trial. See the attached memo for complete details. (Lindsay, Maurice)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 3:08-cv-30184; Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Massachusetts
extension.docketText: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ORDER entered. MEMORANDUM REGARDING DEFENDANTS' MOTION FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT. In its November 8, 2011 order, the court DENIED Defendants Motion for Summary Judgment (Dkt. 58) as to Counts I and II and ALLOWED it as to Counts III, IV, V, VIII, and IX. As noted above, at n. 1, the trial originally scheduled for this case was postponed due to the unavailability of Plaintiffs counsel and the possibility that new counselwould need to be retained. If the case is to be tried before this court, in light of the fact that counsel estimate that two weeks will be needed for evidence, then (in light of the age of this case) the trial must commence by the end of February, 2012. Alternatively, and particularly in light of possible Eleventh Amendment issues, counsel may move to remand the two remaining state law claims to state court. Counsel are hereby ordered to submit a joint status report, on or before January 9, 2012, setting a trial date for some Monday on or before February 27, 2012. Alternatively, counsel may file a motion to remand Counts I and II to state court for trial. See the attached memo for complete details. (Lindsay, Maurice)

titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ENDORSED ORDER entered denying 73 Motion to Remand Case to State Court. DENIED. Given the delays already incurred, remand would be unfair to Defendants. To accommodate plaintiff's counsel, the trial is set for May 7, 2012. Counsel will appear for a status conference on March 22, 2012 at 3:00 pm. So ordered. (Lindsay, Maurice)

titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ENDORSED ORDER entered denying 97 Motion in Limine on Count II. DENIED, without prejudice. Evidence of others' negligence may be relevant to the jury's assessment of the possible impact of the negligence of Kane or Gobeille. So ordered. (Lindsay, Maurice)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 3:08-cv-30184; Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Massachusetts
extension.docketText: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ENDORSED ORDER entered denying 97 Motion in Limine on Count II. DENIED, without prejudice. Evidence of others' negligence may be relevant to the jury's assessment of the possible impact of the negligence of Kane or Gobeille. So ordered. (Lindsay, Maurice)

titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ENDORSED ORDER entered granting 98 Motion in Limine to Exclude any reference to prior convictions. ALLOWED, except as to the convictions for receiving stolen property - unless the drift of testimony opens the door. So ordered. (Lindsay, Maurice)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 3:08-cv-30184; Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Massachusetts
extension.docketText: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ENDORSED ORDER entered granting 98 Motion in Limine to Exclude any reference to prior convictions. ALLOWED, except as to the convictions for receiving stolen property - unless the drift of testimony opens the door. So ordered. (Lindsay, Maurice)

titleInfo.title: Brace v. Commonwealth of Massachusetts et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Judge Michael A. Ponsor: ORDER OF DISMISSAL RE: COUNT II, entered. As follows: Count II is hereby DISMISSED. The trial set to commence on May 7, 2012 willfocus entirely upon Count I, the MTCA count, and specifically upon the negligence of Jennifer Kane and Steven Gobielle, for which the Commonwealth is alleged to be vicariously liable. See the attached order of dismissal for complete details. (Lindsay, Maurice)
